jhelp.util.io

Class IndexedInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • jhelp.util.io.IndexedInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class IndexedInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream
    Input stream that you can know the reading index (Number of bytes actually read) at any time
    Author:
    JHelp

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b,
       int off,
       int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Read some byte and write them inside a given array

        Parent documentation:
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.InputStream
        Parameters:
        b - Array where write read bytes
        off - Offset inside array where start write bytes
        len - Number of bytes to write at maximum
        Returns:
        Number of bytes effectively read from stream and write to the array OR -1 if we are at the end of the stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - On reading issue
        See Also:
        InputStream.read(byte[], int, int)
